verses.roman:
kabhu netre nāsāya jala, mukhe paḍe phena
amṛtera dhārā candra-bimbe vahe yena

synonyms: kabhu—sometimes; netre—from the eyes; nāsāya—from the nostrils; jala—water; mukhe—from the mouth; paḍe—fell; phena—foam; amṛtera—of nectar; dhārā—torrents; candra-bimbe—from the moon; vahe—flow; yena—as if.
translation: Water flowed from His eyes and sometimes through His nostrils, and foam fell from His mouth. These flowings appeared to be torrents of nectar descending from the moon.
